message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you an exclusive opportunity to purchase this incredible product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm confident you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $800000. This is a fair price considering its value and uniqueness.
I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I'm not sure I can go as high as $800000. I'm willing to pay $600000 for the product. Can we meet in the middle at $700000?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm not ready to meet you at $700000 just yet. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to get closer to my initial offer. I'll counter with $750000. This is the best I can do for now.
I understand you're trying to get closer to your initial offer, but I'm still not comfortable with $750000. I'm willing to pay $680000 for the product. Can we meet in the middle again?

I understand your concerns, Bob, and I appreciate your persistence. However, I'm still not willing to go as low as $680000. I'll counter with $730000. This is the best I can do for now, considering the value of the product.
I appreciate your persistence, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with $730000. I'm willing to pay $690000 for the product. This is my final offer, I'm not willing to go any lower.

I understand that you've made a final offer, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell the product for $690000. I'm willing to make one more counteroffer. I'll sell the product to you for $720000. This is my final offer.
I'm not willing to go any higher than $700000, Alice. I think that's a fair price for the product. I'm willing to meet you at this price, but I'm not going to go any higher.

I understand that you're sticking to your price, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell the product for $700000. I'll make one more counteroffer. I'll sell the product to you for $725000. This is my final offer.
